page.title: 01ARTIGARVAN - General view.
page.content: Artigarvan stands on the bank of the Glenmornan River, approximately three miles north east of{Strabane}, in Co. Tyrone. The main source of employment in Artigarvan and the surrounding area is the{Leckpatrick Creamery Co-Operative, which processes the milk produced by dairy farmers in the immediate area. The river which flows through Artigarvan was once one of the busiest rivers in Ulster, providing power for four corn mills, a sawmill, a paper mill and a spade factory.One of the biggest water wheels in Ireland, 2O feet in diameter, is to be seen here, although it is not in use today. This is an agricultural area with fertile farmland.Most of the land is grassland and is used for{Dairy {Farming.}
